intro: Anisocycla blepharosepala subsp. tanzaniensis, commonly known as the Tanzanian anisocycla, is a flowering plant native to Tanzania. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its distinctive leaf morphology and showy inflorescences. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded habitats within montane forests. Its leaves are opposite and have a unique shape, while the flowers are clustered in whorls. This subspecies is of interest to botanists due to its morphological variation and ecological adaptations.
